basics.name: Kate Hamada
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2027.

work.summary: Provided academic support with homework on core subjects for middle and high schoolers. Designed coding activities during STEM Day events where students were introduced to foundational programming concepts.

Taught intro and intermediate Python to middle school students in an after school program. Adapted lesson plans to accommodate a wide range of coding experience levels. Provided debugging guidance to help students overcome challenges as well as encouraging a collaborative environment where they could also help each other debug.

volunteer.summary: Encouraged kids to stay in shape for other sports as well as giving them advice on how to get faster.

awards.title: Outstanding Althelic Student Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to seniors in high school who demonstrate a combination of athletic and academic excellence.

awards.title: First place
awards.summary: My team won first place in 2015.  See my portfolio site for more details.
